  “呐，如果还有下次，你还会在农场等我吗。”
   她额头渗着汗水，衣服上沾满了她的血。行将就木却依然充满光明的望着我。
   我发抖地压着她的伤口，她的血还是如同止不住的大堤一样。不要说一些白痴的话了，哪有什么如果如果！这一次就一定能带你出去！
  “谢谢你，到现在也还在鼓励我……”她低下眼眸，像是做了什么决定一样的，眼神重新凝聚了起来。
   “你不用勉强自己哟……这不是你的使命，没有必要像蚕一样躲在蚕蛹里面。其实外面的世界也很美好哟，有蓝蓝的天空，有蜿蜒的小溪…可以在草地上铺一层报纸，把自己喜欢的东西放在上面，看着花开花落，然后一口一口吃掉……最好，在叫上一个喜欢的人就好了……但是我太胆小了呢，到现在一次都没有叫过呢。”
  老子不想听这些！我让你现在闭嘴！保持精神！我大声对她嘶吼，声带却忍不住的哽咽。
  “小时候，我经常来这里……当时我最喜欢的是什么，你猜一下好吗……”她盯着我，眼里都是泪水，但是充满了温柔。
  我明明不想再让她说话，却逐渐发现了一个令人绝望的事实。
  从什么时候，我连眼泪都不会掉了。明明心里全是痛苦的扭曲，血液都好像要从血管里迸发出来，但是却流不出来。
  “当时，我最喜欢的就是坐在那个谷草堆面前，看你辛苦的打着麦子，割草……当时就觉得务实的男人原来是这么帅啊，比那些天天追我带我去演唱会的男生好多了。我可以看你打一天的麦子，却不愿意陪他们去看一小时的电影……”
 她的声音开始变得缓慢，却一个字一个字击碎了我的心。 
  “但是，为什么呐，他们都这么讨厌你……我爸爸说我再来找你就要断绝父女关系，我妈妈也骂我是个不知检点的东西。我明明，只是想静静地看你工作，再看你假装生气的赶我走，然后为我做一顿好吃的……”她微笑地看着我，好像用尽了所有的力气。
    “我被欺凌的时候，是你把他们赶走，我委屈的时候，是你手足无措的陪我。那天我和朋友吵架，在雨天哭着奔跑的时候，是你把雨伞直接塞到我手里……”
  “傻子都知道你的意思了，你还是装的一副好像是我父亲的样子…笨拙，而又可爱”
  她伸出手，抚摩着我的脸。
  “今天是你的生日吧。这么多年，我还是第一次为你过。对不起，偷偷看了你的日记。血祭品什么的，我也是第一次知道啊……所以，如果我能做到，能让你感到一点点高兴的话，希望你能就此停手。”
  世界上最远的距离不是生离死别,而是我就在你面前,你却不知道我爱你。
  但我明明知道，你也是。

Update -  03/28/2018: Wow. Just wow, there are still many improvements that the devs are making to this game. I took a break and now the bugs seem to be gone. Even after taking a break from the game and the balancing that took place while I was gone, I don't see any problems surviving or getting kills like some other players are saying. I believe that these devs are getting this game where it needs to be. Is it perfect? No. But thats why they are still adjusting everything. They want equal chance of winning for both sides of the chainsaw. I now use my steam controller to play and it works great with this game. I try not to use any of the AXBY buttons as that makes it harder for you to look around when playing.

Plus all of the DLC characters that I have been wanting to buy which were previously only available for purchase are being offered to us to earn in game. None of the DLC characters are needed so I think its really nice they did this so that people that cannot afford the DLC can now earn them in game. I may pick up one of the DLCs just to continue support.

The only thing that I am really waiting for now is more game modes. This would be really awesome, but I am unsure of what game modes that they could do as I don't want the game to try and copy Friday the 13th. This game is its own game and it is much better.

Update - 8/11/2017: Most of the issues that I have personally seen have been fixed. The game has not given me one issue since I started back playing. The Devs really care about this game and the people who play it. If you notice a bug. Send them a bug report. I've seen patch notes that looked like they used my exact wording on some issues that I reported to show that the issue was fixed. Everything is running smoother. The Quick Actions that pop up when you are repairing generators and such is much more responsive. Before it had to be pressed early. Now I have had to adjust myself to hitting it right on time and it works. The only thing I have not tried is Survive With Friends. I really hope that it works now. If they have gotten it fixed, then the game will be in perfect working condition and they will be able to add in new content faster. They have still been adding in DLC while they were fixing everything. They have changed some of the sound effects and UI. Some I liked better before and some I like better now.  

They even made an update that gives you hints during the load screen. For everyone that hated that they didn't know who the killer is. They now give you a hint saying something like When you are going against the Huntress, she does this and that. So this means you are facing the Huntress this match. It's a great addition and it gives you a minute or two to plan out your strategies. 

It's a good game, it really is.


The game itself, if you look at it from a broad point of view can seem repetitive. but once you actually play it, you will see that each game will vary quite a bit as each killer and survivor(the players) play much differently from each other. Whether its the way that they hunt, staring at you after you are on a hook. Or starting their chainsaw and zooming to the other side of the map (me).  Then some survivors have their hiding skills so proficient that you won't see them most of the game, others will actually show up quite often and juke you then they disappear for a while, the last of the survivors are extremely predictable and are the first ones to go (also me).

There is nothing more satisfying as finally catching one of the survivors after they evade you for so long.  The same goes for juking the killer and watching him run in circles for 30 seconds then he runs to another generator.

After all of the fixes and everything that the devs have done. I have brought my rating from 7/10 to 8.75/10.

Don't avoid this game. Give it a shot, if you are scared that you won't like it, just catch it on sale.  It's worth it.

Dead By Daylight:  A competitive Multiplayer Survival Horror with some asymmetric gameplay that's been almost inspired by Evolve.  A fleshed out (albeit flawed) perk system and levelling system given the name 'The Bloodweb'.

On paper, this game sounds excellent.  Dozens of maps, 7 different survivors (each with different cosmetics) and 6 different killers (almost no cosmetic choices until prestiging or buying DLC).  The game sounds fun and for a while, IS fun.  But the problem with games like this, horror games in particular:

The scares wear off as you become experienced.

Of course, there will be the occasional surprise.  Perhaps you didn't see good old Micheal Myers until he grabs you by the throat and throws you on a coat hanger to be shipped to the god of the sky.  Perhaps you're on the brink of escape and you get slashed at the last second by a enraged Hillbilly with a chainsaw.  But I just want to make things clear before I keep going with the review.

I liked this game.  Since release I've liked this game, and I've been dying to write a review praising it.  But now, I've seen what the game really is.

To sum it up very simply:  Buggy, Unbalanced, Toxic and being made by the wrong people.

If you thought Goat Simulator was buggy, this game just takes the cake.  A constantly screaming Nurse when you try to blink, survivors and killers getting stuck on invisible walls, games not ending when all survivors escape, perks not working as intended, and so on.

Have any of these been addressed by the devs?

Nope.  All they've said is that they'll get to it eventually.

Next is the IMBA, the horrible balance.  There is pretty much a heirarchy of perks in this game.  With Sprint Burst and Self Care being the S-class for the survivors, and Nurse's Calling and No One Escapes Death for killer.  It makes the game that is built on variety in a very repetitive environment (the mission is ALWAYS the same: Get 5 gens and open the door) even more repetitive, with every killer playing Nurse, Trapper or Hillbilly simply because they are superior to the others at doing what they are all meant to do, kill.

Even though they are the best at killing and can be a pain to play against.

[i] The game is easy. [b] So [/b] easy as survivor.[/i]

Once you get out of the hell that is the lowest rank and get competent teammates (not good, competent) or you play with friends while using discord or teamspeak.  You will win.  I can guarantee that if you ever Survive With Friends you will always get enough points to rank up.  If you don't then one of your friends will.

Not to mention a killer you pay $7 for is literally the weakest in the game and you're lucky for killing anyone with.

On the topic of SWF though, more than half the time the people you meet as killer are toxic.  And I don't mean they're made of toxic waste.  They will flame you, [i] hard [/i] just for playing the way you want to play.  If you do any of the following, you're a target:

1. Camp

2. Patrol

3. Hook

4. Chase

5. Juke

6. Kill

7. Exist

8. Say 'gg' at the end of the game after killing noone and losing rank.

It is much better to just completely disconnect from the community in this game than to look for people who are good (they DO exist, but they are far too few to justify looking for them).

[spoiler]bet you they'll start commenting on this review saying things like 'oh you're just salty lol' for saying it how it is[/spoiler]

And for my final point:  The Developers.

Oh these fellows are something.

Imagine this:  A gamebreaking exploit was discovered on the holiday season, they've recently added a report system that lets people tell the devs who's not following the TOS.  People start reporting who's doing it.  Wanna know what the devs do?

[spoiler]sit back and wait until the holiday season is over to do anything to stop the exploit or punish the people exploiting[/spoiler]

Not to mention they hardly (if ever) have banned someone for misuse of the game or exploiting.  They just have the report system to make the toxic community feel like they can get some frontier justice against people who did anything on the list above.

For the longest time I loved this game, I would crusade over to reddit and praise it's name and tell the people who thought the devs sucked and the game was unfair to hang themselves from a meathook or die from a crazed killer.  But now I understand the error of my ways.

Don't buy this game.  Don't waste your money promoting the horrible buisness and developer decisions the people at Behaviour Interactive have made.  Don't join the community more toxic then depleted uranium.  Don't let Dead By Daylight live like this.

Es muy buen juego la verdad, yo lo compré en oferta y la verdad que no me arrepiento. Es muy entretenido y está muy currado el juego, se le puede hechar muchas horas y pasártelo genial. Yo lo vi en videos de Youtube y ya de primera me encanto, y más tarde me lo compre. 

Es verdad que tiene algunos errores como el Matchmaking y balanceo  de las partidas, a veces te toca con rango altos, o muy bajos. Pero no es algo que luego influya demasiado a la hora de jugar, al fin y al cabo cada partida es muy diferente y con mucha tensión. Lo que sí que molesta bastante que a mí me pasa a menudo, es el encontrar partidas, tarda muchiiiiiisimo, incluso a veces se queda petado y me tocar forzar el cierre (incluso esas esperas tan largas que hasta se me quitan las ganas de jugar, siendo sincero).

After 90 hours playing Dead by Daylight I also want to share my opinion.
I only played as survivor so I do not know if my following statement can be related to the experience of a killer.

Long story short Dead by Daylight is made of two things:
- Great idea and gameplay
- Terrible matchmaking

Pro_
Actually it's a pretty amazing game and I enjoy most of it!
Sounddesign, Graphics, Gameplay - everything fits to a horror game and the matches are really exciting and thrilling (especially with Michael Myers) if you play alone or in a small group // A full match of 5 friends is just a lot of fun!
The way to optimize your playstyle by upgrading your bloodweb is a cool feature and helps to improve the game experience. You can switch the perks and choose the ones who match your own personal position in a group (like healer, supporter, lurker etc.). The balancing of the different survivors and killers is quite fair, there are a few over-powered perks but the matches as a whole are pretty skill-based, so if you play a lot and gain experience you will outplay even op perk-combos.

Con_
IF THERE WERE NO
- Bugs in matchmaking
Either "Survive with your Friends" does not work correctly and you end up in different Lobbys or don't find a match at all / get kicked to main menu many times
- Hostsystem by Killers
Half of the time the loading screen does not come to an end (the killer has a bad connection to the others) but if it does the whole match is a single frameskip because of delay - the killer has to be the host, instead of the one with the best connection to everyone else where this problems would not appear
- Bugs
There are some bugs and glitches in the game and a few players abuse them knowing that it is not scheduled to work that way (just look in community hub, you will find many videos and pictures)

---Here are some facts---
You play 2 hours (from 19:00 - 21:00)
-> 30 min you are looking for matches ~ 20k player at this moment
-> 40 min you waste on loading screens
-> 20 min you have to re-register for a match because you get kicked to main menu
--------> 30 min (2 matches via 15min) you actually play the game 
^This every day ruins the passion to play or even start it. The programming of the matchmaking and the endless loading screens are an imposition for all players. DBD needs a hostsystem not depending on the killer but the one with best requirements. 

In the current state I would not recommend to play the game (alone), because finding a match is more frustrating and wastes a lot of time.  ~Hopefully devs will work on matchmaking and improve the game experience.
Nevertheless every flawless match is totally worth playing and brings huge fun and excitement to the player! If you can stand the frustrating matchmaking the game is one of the most entertaining things to do.

Bien, ¿Qué podemos decir de Dead By Daylight? Solo recordar los viejos tiempos y ver ese parque en el que nos perseguía un amigo nuestro cuando eramos chicos y teníamos que ''torearle'' para que no nos pillara... Pues de este estilo es Dead By Daylight.

Tenemos dos papeles: asesino o superviviente, como superviviente temerás por tu vida mientras que de asesino disfrutarás cazando gente para acabar con todos ellos.

Tenemos que hacer 5 generadores para desbloquear las puertas y escapar mientras el asesino nos esté persiguiendo para imperdirlo.

Cada vez que acabemos una partida tendremos una barra de puntos en la cual hay distintos apartados de cosas que habremos hecho, ya viene a ser objetivos (generadores), escapar del asesino, aturdirle con tablas que hay en el mapa, curar, descolgar, etc.

La barra de puntos sumará todos los que hayamos hecho en cada apartado dentro de la partida. Dichos puntos nos servirá para subir de rango. 

Red de sangre con la que podremos subir de nivel al personaje que queramos y así ir poniéndole distintas habilidades, ofrendas, objetos, accesorios... Con los que influyen dentro de la partida, todo con puntos jugando partidas.


GRÁFICOS: 8/10 - El ambiente de éste juego es estupendo, no podemos decir que dispone de unos graficazos, porque no está adaptado a ello, pero para lo que es, están bien. No te recomiendo jugar en un pc de bajo rendimiento ya que no puedes cambiar la resolución y se verá bastante borroso, a parte de que sobrecalentará el sistema.

SONIDO: 9/10 - Tanto el sonido como la música son espectaculares, te hace sentir pánico cuando te persigue el asesino o cuando se acerca a ti latiendo el corazón. Hay un par de asesinos que tienen una música distinta al perseguirte: Michael Myers y Freddy Krueger que te hará sentir aún más tensión. Si te encantan los juegos o películas de terror como a mí, este juego te gustará. 
Te recomiendo jugarlo por la noche con las luces apagadas ya que le da mucha más emoción.


PROS

- Perks bastante interesantes con distintas funcionalidades cada uno.

- Partidas que no son nada repetitivas una de otra

- Sistema de rango para valorar tu nivel e intentar llegar al máximo si eres una persona competitiva

- Variedad de personajes con perks distintos cada uno y en caso de asesino, habilidades muy distintas e interesantes unas de otras.

- Los mapas se generan de forma aleatoria en cada partida, con lo cual no te puedes memorizar un mapa para jugarlo cada partida.

- Niebla con la que camuflarse

- Baúles sorpresa con objetos dentro de distintas categorías

- Vegetación, árboles, ventanas, barricadas, con las que poder ''liársela al asesino''


CONTRAS 

-Optimización.

-DLC de pago, (bajo mi opinión, los DLC son decisión tuya si comprarlos o no, no afecta a la jugabilidad, a lo que me refiero es a que no vas a ganar porque te hayas comprado un DLC donde se juegue al asesino/superviviente que contenga), (tambíen hay DLC de skins para los personajes), así que cada uno es libre de comprárselos o no, pero no lo veo para quejarse.

-Juego desbalanceado en muchos aspectos, los supervivientes actualmente están por encima.


MI OPINIÓN

Recomiendo este juego, no solo por su bajo precio, y más en rebajas, para la cantidad de horas que lo puedes llegar a disfrutar e infinidad de niveles, rangos, etc. Sino tambien por la tensión que te hace pasar y la diversión del propio título con ni un dedo de partidas parecidas entre sí. 
Pienso que es un buen juego, tiene muchos buggs y algunos contras pero eso ya se irá solucionando con los parches. 
Creo que es un buen juego para disfrutar jugándolo y mucho más jugándolo con amigos.
